lines.text: As far as I'm concerned, a woman is like an elephant. I like to look at them, but I don't want to own one.
Remember you? You're a window in the house of my life!

[Angrily]
I've learned one thing from you - if you pill rollers flew more and gabbed less, you might find something that'd help us.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text:
[Sarcastically]
What's your school? The diploma mill of Hoosier State?
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text: No, Harvard, Hopkins, Cambridge. I can read and write.
Very impressive! How'd you happen to offer the Navy so much for so little in return?
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text: Well. I'm just naturally generous.
Not to mention your devastating wit!
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text:
[Sardonically]
Tim, the doctor here wants a pair of wings so he can visit his ex-patients. See if you can jam his head into a cockpit.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text:
[Nastily]
Don't use your surgical touch on me, Doctor. I wanna collect my old age pension!
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text: Don't worry, you'll be a burden on the taxpayer for many years.
You're no better at flying than you are with a knife.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text:
[to novice flyers]
Never trust your senses - trust your instrument board!
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text:
[Regarding Lance Rogers]
Surly character, isn't he? I'll bet a sample of his blood would show gall, bile, with a good dash of sulphuric acid.

[Cheerily]
Well, every knock's a boost you know!
Just before I put her into that dive, I kept thinking to myself there are two kinds of blackouts. This belt may whip our kind and the sort they're having over London right now.

[Offering Lt. Lee a cigarette]
Cigarette, Doctor?
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text:
[accepting the smoke]
Thanks, Doctor.
Doctor, I'm disappointed in my judgment. I'm beginning to like you.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Lance Rogers, MD, Flight Surgeon

lines.text: Doctor, I'm just suffering a similar disillusionment. I'm beginning to suspect you're almost human yourself.
Look, if you had a previous engagement with the lady, don't let me stand in the way. We're just pals.
Lee, it's your tough there aren't any women on the Selection Board. You'd be an admiral inside of a year.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text: Don't resign, Tim. I can fit you into a good ground job.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text: There's no such thing as a good ground job, you know that. I'd go crazy every time a plane flew past.
Commander Blake... Sir, I just wanted to thank you for giving me another chance.
Don't mention it.
lines.character: Lt. Cmdr. Joe Blake, squadron commander

lines.text: It's meant a lot to us to train under a pilot like you, sir.
Thanks. Just remember one rule, Anthony. As a pilot, always fight to be on top, and stay there. You can't lick 'em from below.
I won't forget *that*, sir.
